column4: I've got a problem. I have got Apache on my Ubuntu Desktop (working as my server) and am currently trying to install mysql to make everything work, but things seem to be coming from the dotdeb repo. Anybody got any idea on how I can get rid of this not working repo?
gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
through SSH please?
are you familiar with vi/vim?
I juts use vim... people are very fond of nano etc.
errr, vim for windows
Assuming it is there, then sudo apt-get update and move on. If it is not there, ls /etc/apt/sources.list.d and delete it from wherever it lives in there.
my web server over SSH
err, what? I don't have a clue about this side of things, I can manage an existing setup, but I can't set something up, could you give me commands or something please?
I did. You cannot start mysql directly over ssh, so you will need to background the process with an &
how are you trying to install?
what command did you use
apt get install mysql-server
then it looks like you were just missing a piece
I thought you removed that and updated
is there a reason you have those ppas?

if there are ppas in /etc/apt/sources.list then yes, comment them out. but they may exist in /etc/apt/sources.list.d in which case you would sudo rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*  then sudo apt-get update again
dpkg --configure -a
that will need a sudo... sorry.
what was your intention with that?
that attempts to reconfigure broken package installs
now apt-get remove again
